senses.sense_definition: A person who performs the duties of a servant or attendant.

examples.text: The loyal <w>servitor</w> stood silently by the door, waiting for his master's command.
In the fantasy novel, the dark wizard summoned a magical <w>servitor</w> to carry his message.

senses.sense_definition: An undergraduate student, historically at Oxford University, who performed menial duties in exchange for financial support.

examples.text: As a poor <w>servitor</w>, he struggled to balance his studies with his duties to the wealthier students.
The university eventually abolished the rank of <w>servitor</w> in the nineteenth century.

senses.sense_definition: One who serves in an army; a soldier.

examples.text: The old <w>servitor</w> recounted tales of the battles he had fought in his youth.
Every <w>servitor</w> in the regiment was prepared to defend the castle.
